comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: June 12, 2023, 06:20:53 PMLast edit: June 14, 2023, 08:05:53 AM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: Our government did not ban Binance. Also Binance is not the only exchange that Nigerians are using. There are many other exchanges that you can use to trade naira and crypto.I just do not like what I am reading on the news about Binance ban when we do not have enough regulation yet that could make that possible. Also that it is SEC (Nigeria SEC) that ban Binance, not the government.Nigerians can still access Binance. This has been filled with misinformation and misunderstanding from people.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: You see why it is good to do a proper research before coming here to sprout out information you are inundated with.  I was going through the news about it but there was no where I saw that the federal government banned binance from operating but rather it cautioned users and Nigerians to be much careful when dealing so as not to fall for scammers and it still remains n the stand of resisting banks from dealing on Crypto.On the other end binance has refuted the claims and denied anything to do with binance nigeria limited saying I has no affiliation with binance nigeria limited.Source: https://techpoint.africa/2023/06/12/binance-is-not-affiliated-with-binance-nigeria-limited/

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on June 12, 2023, 10:10:05 PMThose exchanges suppose to have offices in Nigeria, or they should stop their services to Nigerians.Having an office in Nigeria is not a big problem; they can always do it, but doing that means they are fully licensed to operate in the country as a legal crypto exchange. I believe they have such a plan. I'm not speaking for Binance, but I'm just saying it based on my personal view of how they show so much interest in the people of Nigeria and provide us with services to serve us better, thereby making a profit. I know of Nigerian guys who are currently working with Binance as part of the local support team, and Binance is not ready to lose Nigerians from patronizing them. If having a physical office will solve the problem, I believe they will do it. The problem is just how our country is always not taking things seriously that could have possibly benefited them in terms of huge revenue generation. Even Bundle Africa, which is also owned by Binance, is largely used by Nigerians.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on June 12, 2023, 10:38:26 PMQuote from: Charles-Tim on June 12, 2023, 10:10:05 PMThose exchanges suppose to have offices in Nigeria, or they should stop their services to Nigerians.Binance is not ready to lose Nigerians from patronizing No doubt mate. Binance knows their own very much and would want to go at any extent to protect what they benefit hugely from. Nigeria has always been a market target for all. So allowing Nigeria market slip away from their hands is like letting a diamond go which they would never allow or let another take away from them.Nigeria is a strong market contending force in the business atmosphere of all international organizations. Every new business would want to have a route or a trace to the Nigeria market because they know Nigerians would definitely have a taste of it. Hence the federal government of Nigeria is taking advantage of every opportunity to stand their position and not allowing anything slip out of their hands.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Even if em be sae FG bans the operation of Binance for Nigeria as you think(which I no sae no be true), there are still  other exchanges that operate in the country that Nigerians go fit the use apart from Binance to continue their trade in crypto. So no need to shiver or make unnecessary assumption that em go fit make people abandon crypto for Nigeria because of that. For Nigeria we get about 10 best exchanges wey peso go fit buy and sell bitcoin. They are: KuCoin, OKX, Huobi, Gate.io, Bitget, Binance, Quidax, Remitano, Buycoins, and Bybit. All these 10 exchanges wey I mentioned, Nigerians dey make use of them, to the buy and sell their bitcoin. It is now left for you to choose the wan wey you want use to trade your bitcoin with. But remember sae, no leave your crypto assets for exchange no matter what.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt jnr on June 12, 2023, 05:30:34 PMSo like dis now Fg don ban Binance way we sti de manage for crypto exchanges chia Guys what is the next move to make oo Because abandoning crypto no b option oYou may have misunderstood the news and the development,  and just to correct you,  binance have not been ban and every Nigerian is free to trade the cryptocurrency on binance but shouldn't use the exchange to store their coins most especially Bitcoin which can be readily held in a custodial wallet even hardware bitcoin wallets device which is the most secured form of self custody wallet. The binance Nig subsidiary should respond to the lawsuit and try to comply with the governmental demand in other to operate a cryptocurrency exchange in the Nigeria business environment and I think this new development will help the government to be able to tax the cryptocurrency exchange and even it users,  so at that, Binance users will be subject to taxation unless for those who hold decentralized coins like Bitcoin in their wallet and trade them on P2P manner that one can avoid tax,  there has always been Tax invasion in the Nigeria system,  and the emergence of cryptocurrency has helped many to avoid paying tax most especially most decentralized Bitcoin coin and its transactions may be untraceable.
